  • Method Details

    • wrapperFindItems

      public int wrapperFindItems(int[] arr, int begin, int end)
      Wrapper function to find the number of items in the array between two given integer values.
      Parameters:
      arr - the sorted integer array
      begin - the begin value indicates left bound
      end - the end value indicates right bound
      Returns:
      the count of numbers

    • findItems

      private int findItems(int[] arr, int begin, int end, int leftMid, int rightMid, int count)
      Recursive function to find the number of items in the array between two given integer values.
      Parameters:
      arr - the sorted integer array
      begin - the begin value indicates left bound
      end - the end value indicates right bound
      leftMid - the left middle is used like an left parameter in binary search algorithm
      rightMid - the right middle is used like an right parameter in binary search algorithm
      count - the count increments if number is between bounds
      Returns:
      the count of numbers

    • contain

      private boolean contain(int[] arr, int left, int right, int item)
      Recursive function that uses binary search algorithm to find given number.
      Parameters:
      arr - the sorted integer array
      left - the left argument for left lower bound
      right - the right argument for right upper bound
      item - the number sought
      Returns:
      return true if found otherwise return false
